solution_line_template: The two bags of cat food weigh {num_cat_bags} x {cat_bag_weight} = <<{num_cat_bags}*{cat_bag_weight}={total_cat_pounds}>>{total_cat_pounds} pounds.
Each bag of dog food weighs {cat_bag_weight} + {dog_bag_extra} = <<{cat_bag_weight}+{dog_bag_extra}={dog_bag_weight}>>{dog_bag_weight} pounds.
So two bags of dog food weigh {num_dog_bags} x {dog_bag_weight} = <<{num_dog_bags}*{dog_bag_weight}={total_dog_pounds}>>{total_dog_pounds} pounds.
Thus, Mrs. Anderson bought {total_cat_pounds} + {total_dog_pounds} = <<{total_cat_pounds}+{total_dog_pounds}={total_pet_pounds}>>{total_pet_pounds} pounds of pet food.
And {total_pet_pounds} pounds is equal to {total_pet_pounds} x {ounces_per_pound} = <<{total_pet_pounds}*{ounces_per_pound}={total_ounces}>>{total_ounces} ounces.
